meanings.def: having the colour of fresh snow or of milk
examples: a crisp white shirt
a white dress
a plant with beautiful white flowers
The suspect was seen driving a white van.
a spacious room with white walls and large windows
a set of perfect white teeth
His hair was as white as snow.
The horse was almost pure white in colour.

meanings.def: belonging to or connected with a group of people who have pale skin, especially people who come from or whose ancestors came from Europe
examples: white middle-class families
She writes about her experiences as a black girl in a predominantly white city.
He grew up in a mostly white neighbourhood.
middle-aged white men in suits
policies intended to appeal to white working-class voters

meanings.def: pale because of emotion or illness
examples: white with something white with shock
Zack's face turned white and his jaw dropped.
She went white as a sheet when she heard the news.
He looked red-eyed and white-faced, slightly fearful and anxious.
Two white coffees, please.
Do you take your coffee black or white?

meanings.def: the colour of fresh snow or of milk
examples: various shades of white
in white She was dressed all in white.
the pure white of the newly painted walls
In China, you wear white when you are mourning.

meanings.def: a member of a group of people who have pale skin, especially people who come from or whose ancestors came from Europe

examples: Would you like red or white?
a very dry white

meanings.def: the part of an egg that surrounds the yolk (= the yellow part)
examples: Use the whites of two eggs.
Whisk the egg whites until stiff.

meanings.def: the white part of the eye
examples: The whites of her eyes were bloodshot.

meanings.def: white clothes, sheets, etc. when they are separated from coloured ones to be washed
examples: (British English) Don't wash whites and coloureds together.
(North American English) Don't wash whites and colors together.

meanings.def: white clothes worn for playing some sports
examples: cricket/tennis whites

meanings.def: having no colours except black, white and shades of grey (in photographs, on television, etc.)
examples: a film made in black and white
black-and-white photos

meanings.def: in a way that makes people or things seem completely bad or good, or completely right or wrong
examples: It's a complex issue, but he only sees it in black and white.
This is not a black-and-white decision (= where the difference between two choices is completely clear).

idioms.def: having no colours except black, white and shades of grey (in photographs, on television, etc.)
examples: a film made in black and white
